Issues.Title: `select`'s icon is off when text centered
Issues.Body:
Using the snippet of code [provided in the docs](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/select/#with-icons), when a select with icon is put inside a `.has-text-centered` element the icon escapes to the left-side (in my example) of the containing `.field` element. However, simply moving the `.icon` element inside the `.select` element seems to fix the issue. I wonder if this is simply a mistake in the docs or there is something else I'm missing that with this "fix" would break. Using plain Bulma `v0.9.4`, no post processing. Same behavior on Chrome, FireFox or Safari. See [jsfiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/jStefano/uedf7hvg/) ```html

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`select`'s icon is off when text centered" (#3552)

Issues.Title: Improved JavaScript for the modal example
Issues.Body:
Improves the efficiency of the JavaScript code in the [javascript implementation example](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/modal/#javascript-implementation-example) for the modal. 


1.  Removed small bloating functions for managing the state of the modals. These functions just create more code for a few one-liners. Using [optional chaining](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Optional_chaining) is much more concise.

2. Changed the variable names in the event listeners for the modal children for more readability. The "data-target" attribute is a string reference to the ID of the modal itself.

3 & 4. Replaced the earlier removed functions with appropriate one-liners.

5a. keyCode is [deprecated](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode)

5b. Instead of checking every single '.modal', just get the active modal and deactivate it.

### Tradeoffs

- Readability


By the way: I really how Bulma has turned out!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Improved JavaScript for the modal example" (#3551)

Issues.Title: How to deal with "missing href in anchor" linter errors when using tabs or dropdowns
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.
I need help.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4]
My **browser** is: Chrome Version 103.0.5060.53 (Official Build) (64-bit)

This is a repost of #3325 

### Description

Whenever I use components like, e.g., [tabs](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/tabs/) or [dropdowns](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/dropdown/) where the entries are anchor elements `<a>`, I get a linter error

> The href attribute is required for an anchor to be keyboard accessible. Provide a valid, navigable address as the href value. If you cannot provide an href, but still need the element to resemble a link, use a button and change it with appropriate styles. Learn more: https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/blob/master/docs/rules/anchor-is-valid.md  jsx-a11y/anchor-is-valid

I tried to use button elements of class `is-ghost` instead of the anchor element, but at least for the tabs, these do not get rendered properly.

What would be the best practice to add tabs and dropdown entries that "feel" like hyperlinks (mouse cursor, etc.) and make the linter happy? Did I miss anything in the docs?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to deal with "missing href in anchor" linter errors when using tabs or dropdowns" (#3548)

Issues.Title: While I'm an advocate for the use of visited link colors, most Bulma users either don't want it or don't use it because it's hard to override for deeper elements.
Issues.Body:
While I'm an advocate for the use of visited link colors, most Bulma users either don't want it or don't use it because it's hard to override for deeper elements.

You could wrap it in a `$visited-links` flag set to `false !default`.

_Originally posted by @jgthms in https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/2416#issuecomment-493390098_

--

Hi,
After a Bulma upgrade to 0.9.4,  I got stuck with visited links that are really hard to override and it breaks all my links colors, since I have custom color link logic. Has mentioned by @jgthms, it would be great to be able to disable this feature to keep the initial color defined by the link.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "While I'm an advocate for the use of visited link colors, most Bulma users either don't want it or don't use it because it's hard to override for deeper elements." (#3546)

Issues.Title: Fix usage of ltr/rtl padding for notifications (Fixes #3025)
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **bugfix**. Addresses #3025 

### Proposed solution

Unify the usage of ltr and rtl padding values behind one variable, `$notification-padding`.

Currently, `$notification-padding` is set, but isn't used at all. The real padding is written using `+ltr` / `+rtl` mixins, and using the specific values `$notification-padding-ltr` and `$notification-padding-rtl`. 

This obscures what we really want to do: __Offer a configurable value for padding, and set an appropriate default based on the value of `$rtl`.__

To correct this, we create a 4th variable, `$default-notification-padding`, which is populated by `@if $rtl`, then set the default (replaceable) value of `$notification-padding` with this new variable.

### Tradeoffs

- Add a new variable that isn't necessarily worth documenting, and makes this definition more verbose
- Add an insignificant amount of compute time during render

### Testing Done

<!-- BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR PR, MAKE SURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS: -->
- [x] Pull the latest `master` branch
- [x] Make sure your Sass code is compliant with the [Bulma Sass styleguide](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#bulma-sass-styleguide)
- [x] Make sure your PR only affects `.sass` or documentation files
- [x] [Try your changes](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#try-your-changes).

The following code blocks are pairs of (test case `bulma.sass`, and the output of `grep -A4 "\.notification {" css/bulma.css` after running `npm run build`):

```bulma.sass
@charset "utf-8"
/*! bulma.io v0.9.4 | MIT License | github.com/jgthms/bulma */
@import "sass/utilities/_all"
@import "sass/elements/notification.sass"
```
```css/bulma.css
.notification {
  background-color: whitesmoke;
  border-radius: 4px;
  position: relative;
  padding: 1.25rem 2.5rem 1.25rem 1.5rem;
```

Here we see the default still stays ready for ltr with a delete button on the right.

```bulma.sass
@charset "utf-8"
/*! bulma.io v0.9.4 | MIT License | github.com/jgthms/bulma */
@import "sass/utilities/_all"
$rtl: true
@import "sass/elements/notification.sass"
```

```css/bulma.css
.notification {
  background-color: whitesmoke;
  border-radius: 4px;
  position: relative;
  padding: 1.25rem 1.5rem 1.25rem 2.5rem;
```

When `$rtl` is enabled, the padding is now updated without any other changes.

```bulma.sass
@charset "utf-8"
/*! bulma.io v0.9.4 | MIT License | github.com/jgthms/bulma */
@import "sass/utilities/_all"
$rtl: true
$notification-padding: 0px
@import "sass/elements/notification.sass"
```

```css/bulma.css
.notification {
  background-color: whitesmoke;
  border-radius: 4px;
  position: relative;
  padding: 0px;
```

Now even with `$rtl` enabled, the output is still the specified value of `$notification-padding`.

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix usage of ltr/rtl padding for notifications (Fixes #3025)" (#3544)

Issues.Title: Add feature Modal is-xx sizes #2482
Issues.Body:
This is a ** new feature **.

Attempt to fix #2482

### Proposed solution
Resize Modal layout with five new classes: `.is-small`, `.is-medium`, `.is-large`, `.is-wide` and `.is-full`.

This features are Responsiveness so they work on mobile, touch, desktop and wide.

### Tradeoffs

Append to `.modal-content` or `.modal-card` classes.

### Testing Done

I have tested these classes into a project and they work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add feature Modal is-xx sizes #2482" (#3541)

Issues.Title: Add feature is-sticky
Issues.Body:
This is a **new feature**.

### Proposed solution

The position sticky in CSS allows you to position the element according to the normal flow of the document (unlike fixed), then when we scroll the page, its position remains fixed with respect to scrolling.
Tradeoffs

This solution adds an "is-sticky" parent class that positions the object on the top of the page. It also adds an "is-sticky-bottom" child class which instead places an object at the bottom of the page. For example to position a button that refers to the top of the page.

### Changelog updated?

No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add feature is-sticky" (#3540)

Issues.Title: Fixes wrong import path in page customize with sass-cli #3489
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.
Fixes #3489

### Proposed solution

Two changes:
1. Fix bulma folder path for unzipped releases, adding the intermediate `/bulma` folder
2. Replace hardcoded paths in `docs\_includes\steps\add-custom-styles.html` with a variable "path" and a for loop. Pages `with-webpack.html` and `with-node-sass.html` pages assign path to `../node_modules/bulma` and page `with-sass-cli.html` sets it to `../bulma-{version}/bulma`

### Tradeoffs

The for loop adds a tiny bit of complexity.

### Testing Done

None.

### Changelog updated?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixes wrong import path in page customize with sass-cli #3489" (#3539)

Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma 0.9.4
My **browser** is: all

### Description

Bulma makes no mention of font sizes in the documentation. But as soon as I import the CSS file all my headings shrink. Why is this happening? Please don't do it

### Steps to Reproduce

Make an html file with an `<h1>` element. See it's big. Add Bulma. See the heading is small.

### Actual behavior

Issues.Body:

Bulma

Bulma
Feature/question?

Bulma **CSS framework**

### Description

Hi. Can we customise Bulma without SASS please?  I'm looking to use a CSS-only framework, without a compilation step, in a small website, which is how I Google Bulma. And was wondering if I can just overwrite your variables with my own --css-variables.  The docs don't mention what variables I'd need to change this.

Issues.Title: New variables: tag focus/active background colors
Issues.Body:
This is an **improvement**.
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
The background colors for focused/active tags were moved to variables.

### Proposed solution

The proposed variables contain the former hard-coded values, so the compiled CSS has no changes.
This enables changing the background colors for focused/active tags using ```!default``` like most other colors. Also, removing the hardcoded ```darken()``` call will allow using a CSS custom variable instead of a color.

### Tradeoffs

Two new variables.

### Testing Done

<!-- BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR PR, MAKE SURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS: -->
<!-- 1. Pull the latest `master` branch -->
<!-- 2. Make sure your Sass code is compliant with the [Bulma Sass styleguide](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#bulma-sass-styleguide) -->
<!-- 3. Make sure your PR only affects `.sass` or documentation files -->
<!-- 4. [Try your changes](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#try-your-changes). -->

<!-- How have you confirmed this feature works? -->
<!-- Please explain more than "Yes". -->
Compiled all right to CSS.

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->

Issues.Title: .list style is gone by 0.9.4
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem
There is no .list class in 9.0.4 . My app made heavy use of the .list class, and now has significant usability compromises. 

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

his is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4]

### Description

It appears to be gone from the main site, too. What I see on this site doesn't seem to be true of 0.9.4:  https://bulma.dev/classes/list/list

Issues.Title: Navbar on mobile is not dark
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about Bulma -- with a dark navbar, when you switch to a mobile view and you open it with the burger, the navbar is light with dark text. I expect the navbar to keep the same styles (`is-dark`) as in desktop, but unfortunately it seems to default to a light menu on mobile.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar on mobile is not dark" (#3530)

Issues.Title: Tabs do not indicate focus well
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**. My users can go through the page elements with the TAB key. This works for many input elements but it does not work well for Tabs. They do not have a proper indication for the focused state. Example: ```
  • Tab 1
  • Tabulator for page 2
``` If you try to focus through the elements with TAB key, you can see it does not indicate focus well on the tabs (tested on Firefox and Chromium). The text input field does focus indication very well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tabs do not indicate focus well" (#3529)

Issues.Title: Change Suggestion for tabs
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma .

This is a request for change the "tabs"-setup in Bulma to reduce JavaScript for a solution .

In the current version of Bulma, you need JS to change the active tab and to 
show a different content-panel associated with the new tab selected.

But there are pure CSS solutions (making use of the :checked-property) 
for this problem if you use radio-buttons instead of the link <a>.
https://codepen.io/markcaron/pen/MvGRYV

Therefore I suggest to base the "tabs" on "radio buttons" and "labels" instead of  <ul> and <a>-tags so that such a pure css solution is feasible to implement.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Change Suggestion for tabs" (#3528)

Issues.Title: Remove duplicate link
Issues.Body: Fix for the duplicate 'love' link in footer: The `site.data.links.more` array already includes 'love': https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/a170216c6cd356cb89b1bdc31e0da1472cbfd2b2/docs/_data/links.json#L694 This is a **documentation fix**.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove duplicate link" (#3527)

Issues.Title: Fixes #3468
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **bugfix | documentation fix**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->
This PR fixes #3468

### Proposed solution

<!-- Which specific problem does this PR solve and how?  -->
This PR fixes icons overlapping when input has a right icon and a loading icon.
<!-- If it fixes a particular Issue, add "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER" in your title -->

### Tradeoffs

<!-- What are the drawbacks of this solution? Are there alternative ones? -->
<!-- Think of performance, build time, usability, complexity, coupling…) -->

### Testing Done
Use the documentation to test the problem of the right icon overlapping a loading icon.

Before:
![Screenshot from 2022-04-29 17-45-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19561201/166066987-f4463ed8-7c4b-4d6e-a055-d2d94dba20f3.png)

After:
![Screenshot from 2022-04-29 17-46-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19561201/166067015-5d8d5fc4-ba9b-42d4-a0ff-f09314354ba3.png)

Issues.Title: `select` class does not reliably update option selection when using `selected` attribute
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
This is a re-post of https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/3390, which was closed due to inactivity, despite not having been addressed. The issue continues to impact users in production in multiple ways, e.g. https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/321, https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/366, https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/372.

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.1
My **browser** is: Firefox 90.0 (64-bit) and Chromium 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) snap (64-bit) on Ubuntu 20.10
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Setting the `selected` attribute on an `<option>` of a `<select>` HTML element, using the Bulma `select` class, does not always cause the displayed selected option to change accordingly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Bring up a page containing an instance of the  `select` class which has `<options>`. (For example, https://bulma.io/documentation/form/select/.)
2. Using the browser developer tools, edit one of the `<option>` tags to contain a `selected` attribute, e.g. `<option selected="selected">`.
3. It may be necessary to repeat this a few times, moving the `selected` attribute to different options, before the bug is reproduced.

### Expected behavior

The option selected in the dropdown display changes to match the `<option>` with the `selected` attribute. (This is the behaviour when the same steps are performed on e.g. https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tryit.asp?filename=tryhtml_select).

### Actual behavior

Initially, the actual behaviour may appear to match the expected behaviour. However, after a few repeats of the above steps, the displayed option selection no longer changes when the `selected` attribute is moved. As a result, the underlying value of the dropdown may become different from the value the user thinks it has. (An example of a user-raised issue resulting from this bug can be found here: https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/228)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`select` class does not reliably update option selection when using `selected` attribute" (#3524)

Issues.Title: Different column sizes per breakpoint for mobile do not work with default size specified (specificity)
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Firefox and Chrome ### Description Different column sizes per breakpoint do not work for mobile if a default is specified. I guess because of CSS specificity. ### Steps to Reproduce Example to emphasize the issue: ``` html
``` ### Expected behavior The column has full width on the mobile breakpoint ### Actual behavior The column still has 4/12 of width because of specificity (`.columns.is-mobile >` is missing): ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42617635/167931859-01df2cd0-c591-47d4-ace8-7f815f9ae0ec.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Different column sizes per breakpoint for mobile do not work with default size specified (specificity)" (#3525)

Issues.Title: Bump nanoid from 3.1.30 to 3.3.4
Issues.Body:
Bumps [nanoid](https://github.com/ai/nanoid) from 3.1.30 to 3.3.4.
Changelog

Sourced from nanoid's changelog.

3.3.4

  • Fixed --help in CLI (by @​Lete114).

3.3.3

  • Reduced size (by Anton Khlynovskiy).

3.3.2

  • Fixed enhanced-resolve support.

3.3.1

  • Reduced package size.

3.3

  • Added size argument to function from customAlphabet (by Stefan Sundin).

3.2

  • Added --size and --alphabet arguments to binary (by Vitaly Baev).

3.1.32

  • Reduced async exports size (by Artyom Arutyunyan).
  • Moved from Jest to uvu (by Vitaly Baev).

3.1.31

  • Fixed collision vulnerability on object in size (by Artyom Arutyunyan).
Commits
  • fc5bd0d Release 3.3.4 version
  • 5ae2628 Update dependencies
  • 2f48e9c Try to fix CI
  • 85991e3 fix: CLI help examples (#361)
  • 89d994c Update dependencies
  • 00547e7 Fix benchmark order
  • a8f4099 bench: add back @​napi-rs/uuid (#360)
  • acd897f Added postgres extension to various README files (#359)
  • 772a613 Update CI and dependencies
  • e7aeb0f Added zig-nanoid to readme. (#357)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/network/alerts).
